org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore
Class ModuleCore

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCore
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEditModelHandler
public class ModuleCore
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEditModelHandler

Provides a Facade pattern for accessing the Web Tools Platform EMF Module Model. ModuleCore can be used as a static utility or an instance adapter.

ModuleCore hides the management of accessing edit models ( ModuleStructuralModel) correctly. Each project has exactly one (ModuleStructuralModel) for read and exactly one for write. Each of these is shared among all clients and reference counted as necessary. Clients should use ModuleCore when working with the WTP Modules Model. easier.

Each ModuleCore instance facade is designed to manage the Edit Model lifecycle for clients. However, while each ModuleCore is designed to be passed around as needed, clients must enforce the ModuleCore lifecycle. The most common method of acquiring a ModuleCore instance facade is to use getModuleCoreForRead(IProject)or getModuleCoreForWrite(IProject).

When clients have concluded their use of the instance, clients must call dispose() .

The following class is experimental until fully documented.

See Also:
ModuleCoreNature, ModuleStructuralModel

Field Detail

ADAPTER_TYPE

public static final java.lang.Class ADAPTER_TYPE
Constructor Detail

ModuleCore

public ModuleCore(ModuleStructuralModel aStructuralModel)

The following constructor is used to manage an already loaded model. Clients should use the following line if they intend to use this constructor:

ModuleCore moduleCore = (ModuleCore) aStructuralModel.getAdapter(ModuleCore.ADAPTER_TYPE).

Parameters:
aStructuralModel - The edit model to be managed by this ModuleCore
Method Detail

getModuleCoreForRead

public static ModuleCore getModuleCoreForRead(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject aProject)

Each ModuleCore instance facade is tied to a specific project. A project may have multiple ModuleCore instance facades live at any given time.

Use to acquire a ModuleCore facade for a specific project that will not be used for editing. Invocations of any save*() API on an instance returned from this method will throw exceptions.

Parameters:
aProject - The IProject that contains the WTP Modules model to load
Returns:
A ModuleCore instance facade to access the WTP Modules Model

getModuleCoreForWrite

public static ModuleCore getModuleCoreForWrite(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject aProject)

Each ModuleCore instance facade is tied to a specific project. A project may have multiple ModuleCore instance facades live at any given time.

Use to acquire a ModuleCore facade for a specific project that may be used to modify the model.

Parameters:
aProject - The IProject that contains the WTP Modules model to load
Returns:
A ModuleCore instance facade to access the WTP Modules Model

getModuleCoreNature

public static ModuleCoreNature getModuleCoreNature(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI aModuleURI)
                                            throws UnresolveableURIException

A convenience API to fetch the ModuleCoreNaturefor a particular module URI. The module URI must be of the valid form, or an exception will be thrown. The module URI must be contained by a project that has a ModuleCoreNatureor null will be returned.

The following method may return null.

Parameters:
aModuleURI - A valid, fully-qualified module URI
Returns:
The ModuleCoreNature of the project associated with aModuleURI
Throws:
UnresolveableURIException - If the supplied module URI is invalid or unresolveable.

getContainingProject

public static org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject getContainingProject(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI aModuleURI)
                                                                throws UnresolveableURIException

For WorkbenchModules that are contained within a project, the containing project can be determined with the WorkbenchModule's fully-qualified module URI.

The following method will return the the corresponding project for the supplied module URI, if it can be determined.

The method will not return an inaccessible project.

The following method may return null.

Parameters:
aModuleURI - A valid, fully-qualified module URI
Returns:
The project that contains the module referenced by the module URI
Throws:
UnresolveableURIException - If the supplied module URI is invalid or unresolveable.

getEclipseResource

public static org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource getEclipseResource(WorkbenchModuleResource aModuleResource)

Returns the corresponding Eclipse IResource, if it can be determined, for the given WorkbenchModuleResource. The WorkbenchModuleResource.getSourcePath()must return a valid resource path for this method to return a valid value. The returned value may be either an IFileor IFolder. A client may use the return value of IResource.getType()to determine what type of resource was returned. (@see IResource#FILE} or IResource.FOLDER).

The following method may return null.

Parameters:
aModuleResource - A WorkbenchModuleResource with a valid sourcePath
Returns:
The corresponding Eclipse IResource, if available.

getOutputContainerRoot

public static org.eclipse.core.resources.IFolder getOutputContainerRoot(WorkbenchModule aWorkbenchModule)

Returns a URI for the supplied WorkbenchModule. The URI will be relative to project root of the flexible project that contains the WorkbenchModule.

The following method may return null.

Parameters:
aWorkbenchModule - A valid WorkbenchModule
Returns:
A project-relative URI of the output folder for aWorkbenchModoule.

getOutputContainersForProject

public static org.eclipse.core.resources.IFolder[] getOutputContainersForProject(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject aProject)

Returns a collection of the output containers for the supplied project. The collection may be a single root output container or an array of output containers without a common root. For clients that are looking for an output container for a specific WorkbenchModule, see getOutputContainerRoot(WorkbenchModule).

If the project is not a ModuleCore project, or has no ModuleCore output containers, an empty array will be returned.

Parameters:
aProject - A project with a ModuleCoreNature
Returns:
An array of output containers or an empty array.

save

public void save(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor aMonitor)

Force a save of the underlying model. The following method should be used with care. Unless required, use {@see #saveIfNecessary(IProgressMonitor) instead.

Specified by:
save in interface IEditModelHandler
Parameters:
aMonitor - A valid progress monitor or null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the ModuleCore object was created as read-only
See Also:
org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.IEditModelHandler#save()

saveIfNecessary

public void saveIfNecessary(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor aMonitor)

Save the underlying model only if no other clients are currently using the model. If the model is not shared, it will be saved. If it is shared, the save will be deferred.

Specified by:
saveIfNecessary in interface IEditModelHandler
Parameters:
aMonitor - A valid progress monitor or null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the ModuleCore object was created as read-only
See Also:
org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.IEditModelHandler#saveIfNecessary()

dispose

public void dispose()

Clients must call the following method when they have finished using the model, even if the ModuleCore instance facade was created as read-only.

Specified by:
dispose in interface IEditModelHandler
See Also:
IEditModelHandler.dispose()

prepareProjectModulesIfNecessary

public void prepareProjectModulesIfNecessary()

Creates a default WTP Module Structural Model file if necessary.

getModuleModelRoot

public ProjectModules getModuleModelRoot()

When loaded for write, the current ModuleCore may return the root object, which can be used to add or remove WorkbenchModules. If a client needs to just read the existing WorkbenchModules, use getWorkbenchModules().

Returns:
The root object of the underlying model

getWorkbenchModules

public WorkbenchModule[] getWorkbenchModules()

Clients that wish to modify the individual WorkbenchModuleinstances may use this method. If clients need to add or remove WorkbenchModuleinstances, use #getProjectModules()to get the root object and then access the contained WorkbenchModules through ProjectModules.getWorkbenchModules().

Returns:
The WorkbenchModules of the underlying model, if any.

createWorkbenchModule

public WorkbenchModule createWorkbenchModule(java.lang.String aDeployName)

Create a WorkbenchModulewith the given deployed name. The returned module will be contained by the root object of the current ModuleCore (so no need to re-add it to the Module Module root object). The current ModuleCore must not be read-only to invoke this method.

Parameters:
aDeployName - A non-null String that will be assigned as the deployed-name
Returns:
A WorkbenchModuleassociated with the current ModuleCore with the supplied deployed name
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the current ModuleCore was created as read-only

createWorkbenchModuleResource

public WorkbenchModuleResource createWorkbenchModuleResource(org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource aResource)

Create a WorkbenchModuleResourcewith the sourcePath of aResource. The current ModuleCore must not be read-only to invoke this method.

Parameters:
aResource - A non-null IResource that will be used to set the sourcePath
Returns:
A WorkbenchModuleResourceassociated with the current ModuleCore with its sourcePath equivalent to aResource
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the current ModuleCore was created as read-only

createModuleType

public ModuleType createModuleType(java.lang.String aModuleTypeId)

Create a ModuleTypewith the sourcePath of aResource. The returned resource will be associated with the current ModuleCore. The current ModuleCore must not be read-only to invoke this method.

Returns:
A WorkbenchModuleResourceassociated with the current ModuleCore with its sourcePath equivalent to aResource
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the current ModuleCore was created as read-only

findWorkbenchModuleResourceByDeployPath

                                                                         org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI aDeployedResourcePath)
                                                                  throws UnresolveableURIException

Search the given module (indicated by aModuleURI) for the WorkbenchModuleResources identified by the module-relative path (indicated by aDeployedResourcePath).

Parameters:
aModuleURI - A valid, fully-qualified module URI
aDeployedResourcePath - A module-relative path to a deployed file
Returns:
An array of WorkbenchModuleResources that contain the URI specified by the module-relative aDeployedResourcePath
Throws:
UnresolveableURIException - If the supplied module URI is invalid or unresolveable.

findWorkbenchModuleResourceByDeployPath

public WorkbenchModuleResource[] findWorkbenchModuleResourceByDeployPath(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI aModuleResourcePath)
                                                                  throws UnresolveableURIException

Search the the module (indicated by the root of aModuleResourcePath) for the WorkbenchModuleResources identified by the module-qualified path (indicated by aDeployedResourcePath).

Parameters:
aModuleResourcePath - A valid fully-qualified URI of a deployed resource within a specific WorkbenchModule
Returns:
An array of WorkbenchModuleResources that contain the URI specified by aModuleResourcePath
Throws:
UnresolveableURIException - If the supplied module URI is invalid or unresolveable.

findWorkbenchModuleResourcesBySourcePath

public WorkbenchModuleResource[] findWorkbenchModuleResourcesBySourcePath(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI aWorkspaceRelativePath)
                                                                   throws UnresolveableURIException

Locates the WorkbenchModuleResources that contain the supplied resource in their source path. There are no representations about the containment of the WorkbenchModuleResources which are returned. The only guarantee is that the returned elements are contained within the same project.

The sourcePath of each WorkbenchModuleResourcewill be mapped to either an IFile or an IFolder. As a result, if the WorkbenchModuleResourceis a container mapping, the path of the supplied resource may not be identical the sourcePath of the WorkbenchModuleResource.

Parameters:
aWorkspaceRelativePath - A valid fully-qualified workspace-relative path of a given resource
Returns:
An array of WorkbenchModuleResources which have sourcePaths that contain the given resource
Throws:
UnresolveableURIException - If the supplied module URI is invalid or unresolveable.

The following method may return null.

Parameters:
aModuleName -
Returns:
The WorkbenchModulecontained by the current ModuleCore with the deploy name aModuleName

WorkbenchModule.getDeployedName()

findWorkbenchModuleByModuleURI

public WorkbenchModule findWorkbenchModuleByModuleURI(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI aModuleURI)
                                               throws UnresolveableURIException

Locate and return the WorkbenchModulereferenced by the fully-qualified aModuleURI. The method will work correctly even if the requested WorkbenchModuleis contained by another project.

Parameters:
aModuleURI - A valid, fully-qualified module URI
Returns:
The WorkbenchModulereferenced by aModuleURI
Throws:
UnresolveableURIException - If the supplied module URI is invalid or unresolveable.
See Also:
WorkbenchModule.getHandle()

findWorkbenchModuleByType

public WorkbenchModule[] findWorkbenchModuleByType(java.lang.String aModuleTypeId)

Searches the available WorkbenchModules as available through getWorkbenchModules()for WorkbenchModules that have a WorkbenchModule.getModuleType()with a a module type Id as specified by aModuleTypeId.

Parameters:
aModuleTypeId - A non-null module type id (ModuleType.getModuleTypeId())
Returns:
A non-null array of the WorkbenchModules that match the given module type id

isLocalDependency

public boolean isLocalDependency(DependentModule aDependentModule)

Returns true if the DependentModulereferences a WorkbenchModule( DependentModule.getHandle()) which is contained by the project that the current ModuleCore is managing. The following method will determine if the dependency can be satisfied by the current project.

Parameters:
aDependentModule -
Returns:
True if the DependentModulereferences a WorkbenchModulemanaged directly by the current ModuleCore
